abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment reviews
            potential adverse environmental impacts resulting from the
            implementation of subprojects, and, proposes mitigation
            measures as follows. Regarding water supply subprojects,
            engineering designs will pay particular attention to aquifer
            capacities, limiting as possible the number of aquifers to
            be exploited, while proposed subprojects in the proximity of
            solid waste disposal sites, or industrial areas, or
            agricultural areas with potential chemical, or fertilizer
            residues, shall not be approved. Barriers should be
            installed to protect water sources, and its immediate
            surrounding areas. Water pipes should be sanded as needed in
            an effort to control corrosion, plastic sealed, and,
            inspected on a regular basis. Sewerage subprojects will fall
            under strict regulations regarding the disposal of flammable
            substances, while the use of resistant sewage pipelines will
            be enforced, to control corrosive industrial residues.
            Appropriate natural drainage systems should divert rainfall;
            conversely, wastewater flows, sludge, and sewage will be
            diverted towards large, non-permeable soil areas, to prevent
            aquifers, and/or surface water contamination. Ventilating
            systems should be installed to prevent air pollutants such
            as fuel, and methane gases.
